fields.description: OED Capacity Building in the Ministry of Education: OED Capacity Building in the Ministry of Education The overall objective of this project is to improve governance and accountability in the education sector in Afghanistan. The expected outcome is improved systems and accountability, which result in higher quality of public service provision by the MoE.

Afghanistan Financial Sector Development Project (AFSD): Afghanistan Financial Sector Development Project (AFSD): AFSD increases financial inclusion and expands access to finance in Afghanistan by supporting the development of favorable, supportive and conducive enabling environment and by promoting innovative and inclusive solutions in the financial sector.

Monitoring Support Project (MSP) Task Order 4 Component 2: Monitoring Support Project (MSP) Task Order 4 Component 2 To develop a web-based platform that will serve as a platform for comprehensive collation, review and analysis of data obtained from Component 1 activities

Afghanistan Business Environment Reform Project (ABER): This program will support the Government of Afghanistan's efforts to create a business environment that stimulates both the private sector investment and job creation.
Capacity Building for Ministry of Public Work (MOPW): Capacity Building for Ministry of Public Work (MOPW)

Road Sustainability and Support Program - Emergency O&M: Emergency O&M (RSSP-I) Activity Description:This off-budget project provides a response to crisis situations such as avalanches, landslides and other structural failures that can lead to road closures through critical stretches of highway in Afghanistan

TBD - DABS PAC II (Da Afghanistan Breshna Sherkat Public Awareness Campaign II): Public awareness campaign in support of, and capacity building of, Afghan utility company DABS to ensure the successful completion and sustainability of energy construction and commercialization activities
TBD - Energy & Natural Resources Development Support: Provide technical assistance and capacity building support for energy and natural resources development

Afghanistan Trade and Revenue Initiative (ATARI): Build capacity of GoA to adequately implement a liberal policy framework for trade and investment in accordance with international standards, enhance its integration in the regional and world economy through the promotion of trade and transit agreements, improve economic corridor governance, and strengthen private sector linkages throughout South and Central Asia.
Regional Women's Dormitories: To build 2-3 women's dormitories on local Afghan universities. The criteria for university selection has not been finalized.
Tourism as a Leading Edge: APS: Tourism development in Albania, in collaboration witt SIDA and private sector.

Accelerated Civic Development and Cooperation project in Albania: The project?s goal, is to support and strengthen the capacities of civil society organizations (CSOs), government bodies, and private sector entities in Albania.

Transparency in Healthcare Engagement: The proposed project will focus on corruption in the health sector and will encourage the cooperation of selected independent government institutions with civil society organizations and media to urge for more responsible governance in health leading to improved health services for Albanian citizens.
Health for All: New Supervision and Capacity Building Malaria, HIV/AIDS, and Family Planning Activity

Purchase of Maternal and Child Health Equipment: Purchase of medical equipment and consumables to support USAID Maternal and Child Health Initiative with the Ministry of Health of the Republic of Armenia

Social and Behavioral Change Communication (SBCC) Activity.: The U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID)/ Bangladesh intends to award a five-year cooperative agreement of up to $10 million. The purpose of the award is to generate demand for and increase use of high quality maternal, neonatal, child and adolescent health (MNCAH), family planning (FP), nutrition, and tuberculosis (TB) services in Bangladesh through the use of social and behavior change communication (SBCC). This SBCC Activity is comprised of two objectives: 1. Increase exposure to and coverage of information on healthy behaviors, services, and health products. 2. Strengthen the Government of Bangladesh Ministry of Health and Family Welfare?s (MoHFW) ability to plan, develop, implement and evaluate effective social and behavior change communication.

Strengthening Multisectoral Nutrition Programming through Implementation Science Activity: Primary specific objectives include: ? Strengthened nutrition leadership at the national and subnational level for improved multisectoral nutrition service delivery and coordination for accelerated progress in addressing both over and under nutrition. ? Test and demonstrate effective, affordable multisectoral nutrition models, targeting the first 1,000 days. Secondary specific objectives within research sites include: ? Increased access for individuals/households to affordable nutritious food, clean water, sanitation, healthcare and social protection; ? Increased adoption of practices that contribute to good nutrition such as increased consumption of diverse, nutrient dense foods, and exclusive breastfeeding in the first six months of life.

Strengthening Political Landscape (SPL). Consensus Building with Political Parties: USAID/Bangladesh intends to implement a 5-year activity to invest in today's leaders, networks and institutions which will be critical in making democracy in Bangladesh more responsive to the needs of the country, more transparent and more inclusive in the future. The Strengthening Political Landscape (SPL) program will support activities that aim to enable political parties to be more inclusive in their internal processes; and to provide political party activists and politically active citizens with the skills to engage constructively to mitigate conflict. The SPL program will be geared towards a future generation of leaders who, when opportunity arises, will be able to respond to requirements of a functional democracy, shaping the political culture that is based on inclusive, responsible

Climate Resilience Innovation and Enterprise in Bangladesh activity (GCC-BAA): This Broad Agency Announcement (BAA) seeks opportunities to co-create, co-design, co-invest, and collaborate in the development of a grant-making challenge fund mechanism focused in the area of climate resilience innovation and enterprise in Bangladesh. The focus of this BAA is to call for Expressions of Interest (EOIs), select a small group of collaborators who will come to Dhaka to develop a concept note, and pending further review/approval, co-design a grant-making mechanism that aims to fund innovative approaches and enterprising solutions that improve the well being of marginalized and vulnerable poor, including women and girls, and their resilience to the risks posed by climate change and extreme weather events (e.g., floods and drought).

Together for Rights and Empowerment (TRE): Possible IRs: 1. Communities are better equipped to respond to violence against women and children (VAWC) 2. Government responsiveness to support VAWC survivors enhanced 3. Increased support services for VAWC survivors 4. Strengthen advocacy for legislative framework to prevent VAWC

Promoting Oversight and Democratic Space (PODS): USAID will support the new Promoting Oversight and Democratic Space (PODS) in Bangladesh activity. In the absence of meaningful political opposition and a strong parliamentary oversight, USAID will encourage active citizenship to enhance democratic space. USAID will also enhance citizens? understanding and ability to express the principles and practice of democracy and good governance by supporting advance civic education programs and creating a network of active citizens with the ability to assess, analyze and promote good governance, accountability and human rights. USAID will increase effective advocacy for protection of democratic space and citizens? rights by supporting research and advocacy campaign, tools and platforms and will enhance non-partisan civil society partnership with gov

NGO Health Service Delivery Activity (NHSDP) Next Iteration: This flagship health project will be USAID?s major investment in direct service provision under the new health sector program. The contractor is expected to work with a nationwide network of approximately 400 clinics to delivery an essential package of health services, ensuring that the poor and under-served have access to health care. This package of health services, as defined by the Government of Bangladesh, includes family planning and reproductive health counseling and services; antenatal and pregnancy services, skilled delivery, child health services, nutrition services and tuberculosis treatment services. The Contractor will be expected to develop a robust community engagement interventions, including behavior change communication and outreach, to encourage the population to obtain

Feed-the-Future Nutrition Activity: This new activity will improve household dietary diversity and reduce childhood stunting. It will layer its interventions within a broad array of Feed the Future and Food for Peace agriculture activities, building on and scaling up previously successful nutrition pilot activities.

Local Solution/Local Capacity Development Activity (LS4LC): Seeking opportunities to co-create, co-design, co-invest, and collaborate in the development, piloting, testing, and scaling of innovative, practical and cost-effective interventions that support USAID efforts to implement projects to: (1) reduce youth involvement in crime and violence; (2) reduce risks and adapt to the impacts of global climate change; and (3) achieve epidemic control of HIV/AIDS throughout the region, which are outlined in the USAID/ESC Regional Development Cooperation Strategy 2015-2019 (RDCS).

Monitoring & Evaluation/PMP: Technical and advisory services to assist the USAID Mission in the Eastern and Southern Caribbean (USAID/ESC) in monitoring, evaluation, learning, and reporting of results during the implementation of its Regional Development Cooperation Strategy (RDCS).

Private sector service delivery bilateral: This new activity is designed to improve the coverage of quality, high impact health services delivered through private for-profit and non-profit health facilities nationwide in order to contribute to the goal of ending preventable deaths among vulnerable populations in Benin.

Harnessing Bosnia and Herzegovina (BiH) Diaspora for Economic Development: The goal of the activity is to unlock the economic potential of BiH Diaspora and increase its contribution to the economic development.

SME Activity: Small and Medium Enterprise (SME) activity will focus on public and private sector with the goal to increase jobs and sales/export in Bosnia and Herzegovina (BiH). The public component will assist BiH government and public sector counterparts to implement international norms, practices and rules in the areas of trade and export facilitation to meet EU and international requirements and implement market based policies and practices that support private sector growth. The private sector component will assist selected private sectors to adopt EU and international standards and expand their market access.

Sustainable Development Activity: The goal of the activity is to introduce sustainable development principles in the economic sectors, while reducing emissions and improving living conditions in urban areas.
Monitoring and Evaluation: Monitoring and Evaluation Activity
New FTF Activity: Feed the Future Cambodia Horticulture Program: Improve food security and nutrition through market-based horticulture value chain

Cambodia Education Project: New EGR Education Program - TO under "Assistance to Basic Education: All Children Reading (ABE-ACR)" IDIQ. The purpose of Early Grade Reading (EGR) Activity is to improve early grade reading skills of children in grades one to three in Cambodia. The activity purpose will be reached by achieving three Expected Results, which are: (1) improved early grade reading instruction; (2) increased parental, caregiver, and community support for reading, and (3) strengthened country and sub-national policies and oversight for early grade reading delivery. The Contractor will assist the Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports (MoEYS) and its Development Partners to create and implement rigorous, standardized approaches to improve Early Grade Reading (EGR) teaching and learning that make use of best pra

Prey Lang Landscape: Building on previous experiences and work from other USAID and donor investments this activity will focus on improving the overall management of the Prey Lang and Cardamoms Landscapes. Activities will target the sub-national level but will also include strategic investments at the national level with various ministries and institutions. This comprehensive activity will focus on biodiversity conservation, strengthening the governance and polices related to the two landscapes, and increase sustainable economic growth within each landscape as well as into the extended landscape area toward the lake.

Climate Service (TBD): Improved the dissemination of weather and climate information to specific users or the public to support better decision-making under present and future climate conditions. Improved the supply of information; considerable attention will be paid to the demand side in terms of capacity to request and use information.
Decentralization Program: Anti-corruption activity to support decentralization and media

Eastern Plains Landscape: The Eastern Plains activities will continue to build on U.S. investments and lessons learned from previous activities. Activities will focus on the improved management of Eastern Plains with a range of appropriate activities taking place at the sub-national level along with strategic investments at the national level with various ministries and institutions. This comprehensive activity will focus on biodiversity conservation, strengthening the governance and polices related to the Eastern Plains, and increase sustainable economic growth at the sub-national level. The economic benefits of protecting the Eastern Plains will be raised to a national level.
FTF Population Based Survey (PBS): This activity will collect and analyze Population-Based Level data at FTF zone to inform progress of FTF program's outcomes.

The Feed the Future Tajikistan Land Market Development Activity: Feed the Future Tajikistan Land Market Development will be accrued under the Strengthening Tenure And Land Resource Rights (STARR) IDIQ.

Power the Future: Power the Future is a five-year project to support Central Asia?s global climate change efforts in large scale renewable energy development and scientific information and analysis for climate adaptation.

Programa de Alianzas Comerciales de USAID - USAID Producers to Market Alliance Program: The purpose of this activity is to improve the competitiveness of rural producers to respond to new and expanding market opportunities. The initiatives designed under this activity are market-led and focus on meeting the expectations of end markets, to ensure sustainability and increased profitability for rural producers and other actors in the selected value chains. The Producers to Market Alliance (PMA) Activity will help close business deals between producers and buyers to increase incomes of small farmers, including women heads of household and members of minority ethnic groups in rural municipalities that are important to achieving a sustainable and inclusive peace in Colombia.

Programa de Inclusión para la Paz - Inclusion for Peace Program: Through this activity, USAID?s Office of Vulnerable Populations (OVP) seeks to support the efforts of an organization to foster social and economic inclusion of Afro-Colombian and Indigenous communities that have been severely affected by conflict, with a special emphasis within that community on people with disabilities, LGTBI population, and women victims of gender-based violence.

Programa de Justicia para una Paz Sostenible - Justice for a Sustainable Peace Program: This program will assist Colombian governmental and civil society partners in strengthening an effective and responsive justice system, addressing the critical justice needs of victims of the armed conflict, and increasing citizen support for the rule of law in targeted conflict-affected regions of Colombia.

Programa Riqueza Natural de USAID - USAID Natural Wealth Program: The purpose of this Activity is to support the Government of Colombia (GOC) in its commitments on conservation and sustainable management of the country?s biodiversity.

Programa Páramos y Bosques de USAID - USAID Páramos and Forests Program: The purpose of this activity is to support Colombia in the implementation of its Agriculture, Forestry and Other Land Uses (AFOLU) related climate change mitigation goals, while strengthening community based sustainable development initiatives in the context of a post peace agreement scenario.

Programa de Cambio Climático de USAID - USAID Climate Change Program: The program will create a platform to support the GOC to implement climate change activities that are connected to national decisions and provide feedback to policy makers and policy making from a bottom-up and top-down approach. Under this program, any assistance given to national, subnational and local authorities should be connected to a policy purpose from a climate change adaptation and mitigation perspective. Efforts should be focused to connect national climate change policies to subnational and local interventions.
IHAP - Integrated HIV/AIDS Programs: Provide services to reduce the incidence and prevalence of HIV/AIDS and provide quality care and treatment services.
Integrated Health Program in DRC (IHP-DRC): Increasing access to and quality of health services while strengthening the capacity of the health system.

Feed the future DRC Kivu Value chains: Feed the future DRC Kivu Value chains will increase household incomes and access to nutrient rich crops by linking small-holder farmers to strengthened and inclusive value chains and supportive market services

Sexual and Gender-Based Violence (SGBV) Activity: The future GBV activity would build upon current activities; it would continue the holistic approach with the four main pillars of: medical response, psycho-social support, legal assistance, and socioeconomic reintegration. In addition, it will be testing Cognitive Psychotherapy in the current activity and plan on continuing those efforts. The new program will include a behavior change communication component to address communities, and specifically men and youth. The program will add restorative justice to complement the formal system and potentially address damages and compensation; engaging local researchers and institutions in data collection and analysis. The program geography may include up to 10 health zones and will respect the Transition Objective 3 priority zones.

Community Protection and Recovery in Areas Affected by the Lord?s Resistance Army: Develop non-lethal community protection systems using a combination of information communications technology, community protection committees, and early warning systems. Assist in the recovery of communities and individuals affected by armed groups through trauma healing, psycho-social support, and social cohesion.

Financial Services Volunteer Corps: The purpose is to support the overarching goal of advancing financial sector integration among the East African Community Partner States and assist in advancing the EAC Secretariat?s mission to integrate East African financial markets, promote reform elements crucial to sustainable economic growth and development, including transparency, financial inclusion and economic justice.

RIGO Strengthening: Regional Intergovernmental Organization (RIGO) System Strengthening will provide organizational capacity development assistance to selected RIGO partners of USAID/KEA in greater East Africa.

Private Sector Development Project for Tourism in Timor Leste: The goal of this project is to sustainably and inclusively develop and expand Timor-Leste?s tourism sector. The activity will improve private sector competitiveness in the country?s tourism sector through environment-friendly use of natural resources and developing price competitive venues and destinations, thereby facilitating inclusive job-creation for the rapidly growing population.

STEM Teacher Preparation Program: In September 2011, the Egyptian Ministry of Education (MOE) introduced advanced Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) education, as part of its formal secondary education system, targeting gifted students who have the desire and aptitude to pursue specialized and advanced levels of science and mathematics to progress on to higher education. To-date, the MOE established nine STEM schools and is planning to establish eighteen more schools by school year 2018/2019. The planned expansion of STEM education in Egypt has already created demand for highly qualified and skilled STEM teachers who have a solid command of English language and demonstrated understanding of STEM concepts. To satisfy the needs of STEM education, USAID/Egypt is planning to fund the implementation of a S

The Literate Village (formally Adult Literacy): Program Goal - All women and primary school aged children in targeted villages possess the necessary literacy skills for continuous learning and self-improvement. Results: Quality of reading instruction for rural primary school aged children increased; and rural mothers' ability to contribute to their children's primary education increased.
Governance Decentralization & Local Administration: Improved service delivery for new governance decentralization and local administration systems in Egypt.

Local Governance Project under IDIQ Making Cities Work: The purpose of this activity is to increase trust in governance in El Salvador by supporting increased decentralization and strengthening the ability of municipalities to plan, pay for, and deliver effective, responsive services in a participatory and accountable manner. The activity will provide targeted, customized, sustainable, and mutually-reinforcing technical assistance to counterparts and partners at the national and municipal levels to support increased decentralization and improve local governance.
Feed the Future - Livelihood for Resilience Activity: Support and enhance livelihood opportunities of chronically food insecure households.

New Firm Fixed Price (FFP) contract to perform end-line performance evaluation of the Yekokeb Berhan Highly Vulnerable Children (HVC) activity.: The purpose of this evaluation is to analyze the effectiveness of the activities? systems strengthening approach to improve access to quality services and health outcomes for HVC and their families and to inform the design of a follow-on activity.

Strengthening Community Response to HIV and AIDS: The aim of the activity is to accelerate the ability of host government, civic society organizations and communities to more effectively plan, deliver and optimize community based prevention, care and treatment interventions for PLHIV.

Improved Wellbeing and Health Outcomes for OVC in Ethiopia (IWHO): This award will be part of the United States Agency for International Development?s (USAID?s) support to strengthening systems to deliver needed services to Highly Vulnerable children and their families in Ethiopia. The current OVC program, Yekokeb Berhan, which is implemented by Pact, in conjunction with FHI, Child Fund, and 34 local implementing partners is a 5-year cooperative agreement and will end on the coming September 30, 2016. Accordingly, a new mechanism as a follow on to this; and it has been designed to extend the OVC service to the needy beneficiaries and to improve health and wellbeing outcomes for orphans and vulnerable children (OVC) in scale up /priority Woredas of Ethiopia by enabling more OVC to utilize services for improving HIV/AIDS care, health, nutrition, economic se

EHIP Water Supply and Management: The EHIP Water Supply and Management activity will provide water supply systems for 11 health centers throughout Ethiopia along with comprehensive management training to ensure that the systems can be properly operated and maintained by the health center staff.

Accelerate Ethiopian Learning Skills: This activity will build on USAID/Ethiopia's suite of first generation READ projects, expanding some best practices that the MOE supports while delving into new programming areas identified as critical for the continued development of "learning to learn" skills across diverse subjects, languages, and geographic areas.

Strengthening the community and Social Services System: The project will contribute to the national target of reducing new infections by 50%. By the end of the fifth year, the service coverage for most at risk populations (MARPs) shall increase, and GoE workplace responses will be strengthened.

Countering Violent Extremism Piloting Annual Program Statement: The program will aim to counter violent extremism in West Africa by funding activities that develop analytical and technological tools. Three selection rounds planned.

Performance Evaluation of the Accountable Democratic Institutions and Systems Strengthening: The overall objective of the evaluation is to assess the performance of the ADISS activity and the performance of the implementing partner, the Ghana Integrity Initiative (GII) since 2014 against the activity goals, benchmarks, and associated results.

Community Roots Project (DG/CARSI): The Community Roots Project will support efforts by Government of Guatemala (GOG), civil society, private sector and community actors to address the underlying causes of violence and migration in areas that are both a high source of migration of under-aged Guatemalans and characterized by a high level of violence in communities not served by USAID?s Convivimos Project; primarily, in the Department of Guatemala.

Urban Municipal Governance Program: The purpose of this Task Order is to focus on improving municipal governance and service delivery through accountability measures that encourage citizen engagement in municipalities most at risk of violent crime.

Fomenting Agriculture Incomes and Resilience (FAIR) Project. Formerly announced as New Rural Value Chains Project: Fomenting Agriculture Incomes and Resilience (FAIR) Project. Formerly announced as New Rural Value Chains Project.

Creating Economic Opportunities: CEO will also assist Guatemala in fulfilling the vision for development put forth in Nuestra Guatemala K?atun 2032, and in particular component ?3. Wealth for All.? CEO will contribute to the Política Nacional de Desarrollo Rural Integral (PNDRI) by developing rural areas. CEO will support Mejoremos Guate by incorporating youth into the economically active population, creating new formal sector jobs, providing support for entrepreneurs, delivering technical and vocational training, transitioning workers and businesses from the informal to the formal sector, and reducing poverty.

National Institution Building for Accountable Governance: Provide technical assistance and capacity building to increase the effectiveness of public administration and financial management systems and processes within key GOG institutions; improve the capacity of public institutions to responsively, equitably, and effectively fulfill their mandate; and increase civil society participation, advocacy, and oversight in government decision making.

Protecting Endangered Flora and Fauna in Guatemala. Formerly announced as "Combating Wildlife Trafficking": Protecting Endangered Flora and Fauna in Guatemala. Formerly announced as "Combating Wildlife Trafficking"

Harnessing Emerging Political Leadership for an Accountable Guatemala (formerly listed as Emerging Political Leadership for a Secure Guatemala (DG/CARSI)): The Harnessing Emerging Political Leadership for a Secure and Accountable Guatemala Project will be designed to incorporate youth from at-risk, high violence, urban marginalized communities that lack opportunities and youth who have been inspired by the political crisis to take a more active political role, with the goal of developing an inclusive, representative next generation of civil society and political leaders.
Monitoring and Evaluation Program: Monitoring and Evaluation Program will provide continued performance monitoring, verification, and impact evaluation of program results of USAID Guatemala projects.
Community Engagement for Conflict Transformation Project: Community Engagement for Conflict Transformation Project (DG/CARSI&DV)

Room to Learn (recompete under the ABE ACCESS IDIQ): Room to Learn (recompete under the ABE ACCESS IDIQ) The purpose of the ?Retounen Lekòl? (Return to School in Haitian Creole: RtL) activity is to support the Haitian Ministry of National Education and Vocational Training (Ministère de l?Education Nationale et de la Formation Professionnelle: MENFP) to increase safe and equitable access to quality education for out-of-school and over-aged children and youth aged 10-18 through the provision of an Alternative Education Program (AEP). RtL is a five year activity that will advance USAID?s global Room to Learn initiative under the USAID Education Strategy Goal 3 ? increased equitable access to education in crisis and conflict environments for 15 million learners.

Midterm Performance Eval North-Pilot Project for Sustainable Electricity Distribution (PPSELD): Midterm Performance Eval North-Pilot Project for Sustainable Electricity Distribution (PPSELD) Solicited under Eval IQC
Port Civil Works: To obtain design and construction services for the rehabilitation of Cap Haitien Port (CHP) in Haiti.

Reading Improvement for Development: Award title changed from Basic Reading & Education Activity (BREA) to Reading Improvement for Development. Education content-­based violence prevention activity. Anticipated as full and open. Subject to CRB review. Procurement plan subject to change.

School-Based Violence Prevention Activity: School-Based Violence Prevention Activity. [Add more description]. Anticipated Award Date is 12/31/2016 based on when Mission desires award online. Actual anticipated award date will be determined and updated based on an approved Milestone plan to be developed, reviewed and agreed upon between the requiring office and OAA Honduras.
PFMPA Activity: Public Financial Management & Public Accountability Activity

Community and Municipal Development for Citizen Security: Community and municipal development for citizen security; in support of DO1 ?Citizen security increased for vulnerable populations in urban, high-crime areas.?

INDIA PARTNERSHIPS PROGRAM APS 2.0: This Annual Program Statement (APS) 2.0 for the India Partnerships Program (IPP) is USAID/India?s invitation to potential Resource Partners. These are private sector businesses (particularly Indian private businesses), foundations, financial institutions, entrepreneurs, investors, philanthropists, and others that can identify and suggest ways to utilize their financial resources to collaborate with USAID/India. This invitation is equally extended to potential public sector partners (e.g., the Government of India, public companies, as well as other bilateral and multilateral donors). The APS is also USAID/India?s invitation to prospective Implementing Partners (e.g., NGOs, private sector concerns, and others) who can engage and work with Resource Partners. USAID/India encourages Indian impl

These are private sector businesses (particularly Indian private businesses), foundations, financial institutions, entrepreneurs, investors, philanthropists, and others that can identify and suggest ways to utilize their financial resources to collaborate with USAID/India. This invitation is equally extended to potential public sector partners (e.g., the Government of India, public companies, as well as other bilateral and multilateral donors). The APS is also USAID/India?s invitation to prospective Implementing Partners (e.g., NGOs, private sector concerns, and others) who can engage and work with Resource Partners. USAID/India encourages Indian impl

BUKA: BUKA (Bukti Untuk Kebijakan dan Advokasi or Evidence for Policy and Advocacy)

Maternal and Neonatal Health: MNH Program is to reduce maternal and newborn mortality by providing catalytic support to improve essential maternal and newborn services targeting the poorest and most vulnerable.

Iraq Governance and Performance Accountability Project: Activities will advance effective, accountable, and transparent governance in Iraq. The effort will work with the Government of Iraq (GOI) at all levels to better respond to citizen needs by supporting reform initiatives and Iraqi change agents on inclusive governance and public sector transparency, accountability and economy. ?Reform initiatives? includes support to improve service delivery functions, public financial management, and open government initiatives, the pace of which will be dictated by the GOI. This activity will support the GOI and the citizens of Iraq in forming partnerships and collaborative efforts, particularly in light of the ongoing fiscal and security crises, to jointly solve problems. This activity will be infused with the principles of equity, representation, and p

WRE- Water Innovation Technologies: In alignment with Jordan?s Response Plan, this cooperative agreement will focus on innovative water saving technologies for host-communities and will target both Jordanians and Syrians. This includes the ability to access finance, receive vocational training and establish aqua/hydroponic production, as well as implement water conservation activities. There will be a significant focus on alternative livelihoods in the northern region of Jordan, specifically in areas highly impacted by Syrian refugees.
EDY - Youth Power: Work with youth to strengthen local-level assets, sources of support, and programs, and engage youth in developing new activities that meet their needs.

OVC: Anticipate 2 awards: These awards are to support orphans and vulnerable children (OVC) in counties across the former Nyanza, Western, Rift Valley, Central, Eastern and North Eastern Provinces of Kenya.

HIV Service Delivery Support Activity (HSDSA): HIV Service Delivery Support Activity (HSDSA) Clinical Services 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5. The primary focus of HSDSA is to identify, link, treat, and retain HIV positive Kenyans within the existing service delivery platform (sites) across focus counties. HSDSA will integrate services previously operationalized by other providers such as hiring and training of human resource for health professionals, and facility-based commodity quantification, ordering, stocking, issuing and resupply/reporting.

Kenya Investment Mechanism: The purpose of the project is to promote private sector growth for development gains. In simplified terms, the effort looks to identify small business (and larger when applicable) and entrepreneurs, and mobilize all forms of capital with technical assistance and transaction advisory services--both by itself and in partnership with other USAID programming--to seed enterprise growth at scale.

Transparent, Effective and Accountable Municipalities (TEAM): (TEAM) activity is to address corruption at the municipal level by increasing the transparency and effectiveness of municipal procurement systems and will focus on the following three program components: 1. Develop, refine and roll out models for transparent and accountable municipalities; 2. Engage the central level in addressing municipal corruption within the procurement process; and 3. Enable civil society to track and expose corruption.
program support - regional IDIQ: IDIQ - Regional program Support
Municipal Competetivenes Index: TBD

Executive Good Governance: Institutional Performance Improvement & Service Delivery Project for USAID Kyrgyz Republic: Executive Good Governance: Institutional Performance Improvement & Service Delivery Project for USAID Kyrgyz Republic. The goal of the project is to increase the capacity of key state bodies to govern well.
Enterprise Development Program: Enterprise Development Program: increasing sales and creating jobs.

Let Girls Learn Liberia Challenge: Depending on the nature of Expressions of Interest received in response to the BAA, it is hoped that any activity(ies) that result will promote interventions and basic literacy skills to increase Liberian adolescent (ages 10 ? 19) girls? access to education in a new and innovative fashion.

Local Construction Works IDIQ Contract (in Liberia): Local Construction Works Indefinite Delivery Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) Contract. This procurement is being limited to local Liberian Constrction Firms

Accelerated Quality Education for Liberia Children (AQE): RFTOP for increased access to education for out-of-school children age 8 to 15 in target counties. Expected to be released under ABE ACCESS IDIQ
READ Liberia!: Read Liberia! is a 5 year activity designed to to improve early grade reading skills for Liberian students in grades one and two in the target countie
Qualitative assessment of the OMS results.: Qualitative assessment of the OMS results.

Yesani Ophunzira Assess the Learners (YESA) Activity: Multi-level monitoring and evaluation (M&E) activity that will build capacity for monitoring and evaluation of early grade reading at national, school and community levels.
ASPIRE Mid-term Performance Evaluation: The activity will evaluate performance of the Girls Empowerment through Education and Health (ASPIRE) activity

Civic Engagement Program: USAID/Mali anticipates awarding a $12 million 5-year Agreement to strengthen citizens? role in the improvement of government accountability. This goal will be achieved by 1) strengthening mechanisms of bottom-up social accountability, 2) strengthening CSO partnerships with the government and private sector to develop public policy and advance issues of common interest, and 3) strengthen citizens? understanding of their rights and responsibilities, and feelings of empowerment to engage with government actors. A primary measure of the success of these activities will be the extent to which they contribute to measurably more responsive and accountable service delivery at the sub-national level.

Civil Society Activity (CSA) - Umbrella: The USAID/Mexico Civil Society Activity (CSA) will assist the Mission in addressing partner organizations? performance gaps that impede the effective implementation of civil society (CSO) activities, to increase the sustainability of their local initiatives through the development of strategic alliances, and to assist CSOs in carrying out activities related to the USAID/Mexico's development objectives. This will be issued as a Task Order under the Human and Institutional Capacity Development Program (HICDpro) IQC.
Community Justice Sector Assessment: Assessment of the Community Justice Sector. This will be a task order under the Rule of Law IQC.

Technical Assistance in Transparency and Anti-Corruption Laws/Systems.: To provide technical assistance to the Government of Mexico in the area of transparency, anti-corruption as related to laws and systems under the Rule of Law IQC.

Comunidades y Energias Renovables (CER): The purpose of this activity is to support and stimulate one of the local civil society organizations in Mexico to work with stakeholders, specifically focusing on local communities, but also working with government, private sector, and academia, to mitigate any potential conflict and empower local communities so they can enhance their social benefits from renewable energy projects.

High Value Agriculture Activity: This activity will target market diversification for a sub-set of most competitive high?value agricultural products, with significant efforts oriented towards tapping into the EU and Middle East market.

Moldova Structural Reform (SR) Program: The activity will focus on aspects of Deep and Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement (DCFTA) implementation where discussions with our EU and European bilateral partners has shown that USAID has comparative advantages, such as trade deregulation and strategic communications on reforms, as well as other further improvements to the business regulatory environment.

Media Enabling Democracy, Inclusion and Accountability in Moldova (MEDIA-M) Activity: MEDIA-M is an activity that aims to promote the development of an independent, professional media that gives citizens access to a variety of perspectives, and to create a media sector that is more resilient to political and financial pressures.

Rule of Law Activity (ROLA): The Rule of law follow on activity will develop the capacity of institutions involved in the administration of courts and the Prosecutor General?s Office, another area highlighted under the AA. This assistance will help to improve Moldova's compliance with European standards and its ability to fight corruption. Activities also will directly combat corruption by engaging civil society, investigative media, and active citizens to monitor the court systems to provide public oversight of the reform efforts. The action type is Task Order under IQC (Rule of Law (ROL) IQC).

Moldova Local Governance Program: The Moldova Local Governance Program follow on activity will help local governments improve the provision of basic services and promote energy efficiency. This assistance will facilitate decentralization, an area of focus under the AA, and build citizen confidence that democratic institutions improve the quality of life. Local governments are the most trusted government entities in Moldova, where citizens have the most influence.

Reading for Success--Formal Education Project: National Program for Reading. To be competed on Education ABE - ACR IDIQ (SOL-608-16-000006). The goal of the National Program for Reading (NPR) activity over a five-year period is to support the Ministry of Education (MOE) to successfully oversee a national reading reform effort for Moroccan children in grades 1-4 by improving their reading skills, fluency and comprehension. This will be done under the Development Objective DO3 of USAID/Morocco?s Country Development Cooperation Strategy (CDCS) for 2014 - 2018 ?Enhanced Educational Attainment for Children at the Primary Level.?

Support to label Commune Citoyenne Initiative: Label Commune Citoyenne is a quality label designed for Moroccan municipalities that promote good governance practices. USAID has been engaged in a co-design effort of this locally-driven initiative along with the German Development Agency (GIZ), and several local NGOs. While this initiative is about granting labels to communes who meet a certain number of good-governance indicators, the difficulty is to support communes that are nearly eligible for the label but are lacking in one or more principles/indicators. Under this proposed program, USAID could provide the necessary support to some of these communes so that they can meet these principles. The proposed USAID program would focus on the principles of participation and transparency, which are interrelated and directly tie in to USAID/M
Local Graphic Designer companies support services: Graphic designer support services

Civil Society Strengthening Program (CSSP): CSSP mid-term evaluation. USAID/Morocco intends to conduct a mid-term performance evaluation of its Civil Society Strengthening Program (CSSP) which contributes directly to the Mission?s Democracy and Governance Intermediate Result 1, ?Increased civil society contribution to the public policy process?. This evaluation will serve the following purposes: 1. To provide the Mission with concrete evidence regarding to what extent CSSP achieved its goals at all levels of the results framework. 2. Determine any recommended course adjustments in the ongoing program and CSSP?s management structure.

LocalWorks Systems Mapping and Engagement services.: Local award to conduct an in-depth systems and stakeholder mapping in the area of gender-based violence to inform the potential design of a localworks program in Morocco. (see https://www.usaid.gov/partnership-opportunities/ngo/localworks for more information on USAID's localworks program).

Communications for Improved Health Outcomes - CIHO: The purpose of CIHO is to increase the adoption of behaviors that promote health, prevent disease, and increase the utilization of health services, which contributes to USAID/Mozambique's Development Objective of improving the health status of Mozambicans.

Integrated Malaria Project: USAID/ Mozambique plans to design a new competitive bilateral agreement, the purpose of the new mechanism is to contribute to PMI`s and GRM goals to reduce malaria mortality in Mozambique through the improvement of service delivery of malaria in pregnancy, case management, BCC, Monitoring & Evaluation and Capacity Building at provincial, district and facility level support. The proposed program will support this objective by developing national and local capacity to scale up high impact and cost-effective interventions to reduce mortality due to malaria.

Climate Smart Agriculture Nacala Corridor: The goal of this activity is to achieve the the reduction of poverty under the Feed the Future (FTF) Initiative by partnering with local communities and existing NGOs to increase productivity and incomes, while strengthening climate resilience. The activities will contribute to increased climate resilience in the FTF target areas in line with the President?s Executive Order 13677 on climate-resilient international development and the FTF global strategy.

Feed the Future Value Chain: The award will focus on increasing agricultural productivity and expanding agricultural markets and trade in the 26 districts of the Feed the Future Zone of Influence. It will include technical services in order to increase the competitiveness of selected value chains, expand the number of enterprises that can compete and upgrade their products and services in selected markets, and improve relationships and linkages between those firms and other market participants throughout the value chain.

Climate Smart Agriculture Beira Corridor: The goal of this activity is to achieve the the reduction of poverty under the Feed the Future (FTF) Initiative by partnering with local communities and existing NGOs to increase productivity and incomes, while strengthening climate resilience. The activities will contribute to increased climate resilience in the FTF target areas in line with the President?s Executive Order 13677 on climate-resilient international development and the FTF global strategy.

KISAN II: The goal of FTF KISAN II is ?to substantially reduce global poverty and hunger. This will be accomplished by five objectives: 1) Improve agricultural productivity, 2) Strengthen the competitiveness, resilience, and inclusiveness of market systems, 3) Strengthened enabling environment, 4) Increase resilience of vulnerable communities through business literacy, and 5) Apply collaboration,learning and adaptation.

Combating Trafficking-in-Person II (CTIP II): CTIP II will focus on human trafficking to support the ?Four Ps?: 1: Prevention ?Public agencies, local organizations and networks serving as frontlines for promoting awareness of human trafficking, increasing local livelihoods to mitigate unsafe migration and avoiding victimization. 2: Protection ? Judicial, law enforcement, and other relevant public and/or private entities providing counseling, skills-based training, legal support and other measures to empower victims of trafficking. 3: Prosecution ? more effective law enforcement and judicial systems that apply human rights-based standards in protecting victims and penalties for traffickers who victimize the vulnerable; and more effective application of both counter-trafficking and labor laws. 4: Partnership ? Coordination between the l

SPPELP II: The project will support Nepal's polticial system that allows citizens to exercise meaningful choice to peacefully and democratically select leaders at each level of government; and members of Nepal's Parliament are capable of mitigating competing polticial imperatives and policy options to become more effective in decision making.
Nepal Community Reconstruction Program Construction IDIQ: Multi-holder IDIQ for firm fixed price construction services
Nepal Community Reconstruction Program A-E Services: A-E and construction management services for the Nepal Community Reconstruction Program. To be released under the A-E II IDIQ

Strategic HIV and AIDS Response Program (SHARP) Nigeria: The purpose of this flagship award is to improve the quality and effectiveness of high-impact, evidence-based HIV/AIDS interventions to meet state/LGA-specific goals and objectives. Specific objectives include the following: 1) Targeted and efficient HIV case identification and linkage to care and treatment; 2) Enrollment of patients on HIV/AIDS therapy with adequate adherence and minimal loss to follow-up; 3) Successfully suppress HIV viral load; 4) Offer specialized services that attract Key Populations (e.g. men sleeping with men, sex workers and people who inject drugs); and 5) Increase GON capacity to expand, oversee and finance HIV/AIDS and TB services.

Small and Medium Enterprise Activity (SMEA): USAID/Pakistan intends to procure services of a contractor to provide technical and financial assistance to develop the Country?s small and Medium Enterprise sector, SMEA will support the enhancement of competitiveness of Pakistan SMEs by improving the business enabling environment, imporving Pkaistan's ranking on Doing Business Indicators, increasing access to technology, markets and finance, and building technical marketing, implementation and management services for SMEs by strengthening Business Development Service Providers. It also aims at setting up a Pakistan Challenge Fund to provide innovative and technology based solutions to development problems.
fields.point_of_contact_name: Maria Hassan, A&A Specialist Juan Esteban Proano, A&A Specialist

fields.description: Architect & Enginneing Services Indifinite Delivery indifinite Quantity Contract: Architect & Engineering Services IDIQ will provide broad technical support and advice to USAID/Pakistan, participating host government entities and regulatory bodies in overall institutional and infrastructure development including, but not limited to, policy, legal, regulatory, financial and commercial development and reform, feasibility studies, design and construction supervision, equipment and commodities provision, human resource development and training, operations and maintenance improvements, and private sector participation.

Let Girl Learn: Through Let Girls Learn, the U.S. Government aims to build partnerships to lift up adolescent girls across Pakistan. The Let Girls Learn approach centers on three pillars: increasing access to quality education, reducing barriers to success, and empowering adolescent girls.
Read Pakistan: Media Campaign to support Education

IDIQ for Human and Institutional Capacity Development for non-Critical Priority Countries: Provision of administrative and financial technical assistance to USAID/Paraguay?s major local implementing partner

Evaluation of Pacific Global Climate Change Adaptation - ( to be issued under a RDMA Thailand IDIQ): This is an external third party evaluation of the overall performance of USAID/Pacific Islands' community-based Global Climate Change (GCC) portfolio. It will guide new project design and adjustments to current projects.
USPSC Deputy Executive Officer: USPSC Deputy Executive Officer

CDCS Mid-course Stocktaking Analytical Support - ( to be issued under a RDMA Thailand IDIQ): This award will involve a Country Development Cooperation Strategy (CDCS) stocktaking to provide the Mission an opportunity to revalidate its strategic approach, revisit core assumptions, and adapt implementation as needed.
Power Africa Expansion Nigeria Power Sector Program: Multiple Award IDIQ to further Power Africa's expansion Seed Task Order No. 1: Nigeria Power Sector Program
Youth Employment Project: The activity aims to increase stable employment for vulnerable youth in Rwanda.

Sustainable Food, Agriculture, and Nutrition (SFAN): Provide services and deliverables to sustainably increase smallholder farmers? incomes and improve nutrition through promoting sustainable agricultural practices, developing markets and increasing consumption of nutritious foods in Rwanda.

Integrated Service Delivery and Health Behaviors (ISD-HB): The flagship service delivery mechanism will ensure high impact interventions are implemented at scale in seven regions of concentrated investment. This mechanism will directly support the achievement of IR 1 (increased access to health services), and sub-IR 2.1 on SBCC to change norms and behaviors essential to sustainable improvements in health. This mechanism will also contribute to other key outputs in IRs 2 and 3, and will collaborate with programs in other sectors, including education, agriculture, water, sanitation and hygiene, and democracy and governance. The ISD-HB mechanism will also provide targeted assistance such as HIV prevention, care and treatment activities to the seven regions in which USAID support is being consolidated.
Governance for Local Development: The project will build capacity of local government in improving service delivery at the local level and will improve citizen engagement in good governance .

Inventory, Reduction and Monitoring of Para-fiscal Charges in Serbia: The contractor will provide technical assistance and services, to help the Government of Serbia (GoS) in its stated intention to tackle its murky myriad of para-fiscal charges.
Strengthening Judicial System: The desired end-state after these activities have been successful completed include the following: Judicial Accountability;Judicial Efficiency; Reduces Corruption

Competitiveness Systems Strengthening: The objective of this activity is to eliminate obstacles to Serbia's competitiveness in order to generate export led growth and greater integration with Europe and global markets.

New Education Activity: The new activity ?seeks to? increase equitable access to education for marginalized populations and ?also to enhance education authorities? abilities to manage and lead the education sector in Somalia?.

Single Holder IDIQ Local - Education Evaluation Mechanism (REED): Single Holder IDIQ - Education Evaluation Mechanism. To provide comprehensive evaluation services across the education portfolio, include performance and impact evaluations, sector analyses, and help establish a community of practice for primary grade reading research.

Practical Education Research for Optimal Reading and Management (PERFORM): Education project to strengthen the capacity of the education system to support teachers in curriculum delivery, in order to improve learner outcomes in language and literacy.
Supply Chain Technical Assistance: Supply Chain Technical Assistance

Southern Africa Energy Program (SAEP) (Power Africa & REED): This activity will work to increase private sector investment in clean energy. It is envisioned that this mechanism will have activities centered around transaction advisory support, policy and regulatory technical assistance, and capacity building.
Voluntary Medical Male Circumcision: Voluntary Medical Male Circumcision
South Africa Mission Support: South Africa Mission Support
Regional Political Party Strengthening: Regional Political Party Strengthening (REED)
Support for Monitoring and Evaluation for Health: Support for Monitoring and Evaluation for Health
ENV: RESILIM Mid-Term Evaluation- (REED): RESILIM Mid-Term Evaluation
Civil Society Building: Civil Society APS - Second Round of Concept Papers

Syrian Livelihoods Activity: Syrian Livelihoods Activity - expected to issue an Annual Program Statement to receive concept papers. Potentially up to three awards to be made, with a total potential value of $15.5 million.
Comprehensive Platform for Integrated Communication Interventions (CPICI): This activity will provide health social behavior change communication (SBCC) activities in Tanzania.

SERVIR Coordinator: The SERVIR Mekong Coordinator is responsible for a range of duties that focus on three major categories: 1) management of the new SERVIR Mekong hub; 2) partnership building, coordination and communication with existing SERVIR partners and collaborators, as well as engagement with potential future partners or collaborators; and 3) technical guidance and advocacy regarding use of geospatial tools and services (in particular those generated through the SERVIR program) to improve decision making and development outcomes.

Counter Trafficking in Persons in Asia (CTIP-Asia): Counter Trafficking in Persons in Asia (CTIP-Asia) Asia CTIP proposes to establish a regional activity that focuses on transnational and regional challenges to combat trafficking in persons as well as provide all USAID operating units in Asia the option to issue Associate Awards for CTIP activities in Asia. Asia CTIP will provide a wide array of services and support to counter human trafficking in Asia and proposed objectives may include 1) reduce the risk of human trafficking, with a focus on vulnerable populations; 2) increase access to support for trafficked persons; 3) improve access to justice and remedies for trafficked persons; 4) strengthen learning around trafficking in persons and interventions; 5) improve coordination and cooperation between source, transit and destination count
Laos Basic Education: USAID/RDMA is considering a development of a mechanism to address basic education needs in Laos.

Urban Adaptation Financing Activity: This new activity will help increase the capacity of secondary cities in Asia, through targeted technical assistance and capacity strengthening, develop technically sound and investment-worthy adaptation project proposals and connect them to public and private sources of climate funding/finance

Regional Innovation Mechanism: USAID/RDMA is considering development of a Regional Innovation Mechanism to support the delivery of prizes and challenges, open innovation activities, and other activities to strengthen innovation ecosystems and support innovators in Asia, across a broad range of development objectives. The mechanism will provide a means of involvement and collaborative ideation by a wide spectrum of participants from higher education, civil society, and the private sector around core development challenges in the region.

Provides entrepreneurship training and firm-level assistance to build the capacity of SMEs in the interior.: PIO - Provides entrepreneurship training and firm-level assistance to build the capacity of SMEs in the interior.
Public Financial Management and Policy: To enhance public financial management systems and policy.
Community Resilience: Community resilience to counter violent extremism strengthened in selected geographic areas.

USAID Regional Health Integration to Enhance Services in Eastern Uganda (RHITES-E): The purpose of this activity for Regional Health Integration to Enhance Services in Eastern Uganda (RHITES-E) is to secure services to support the design and implementation of a comprehensive, integrated investment in regional health, HIV/AIDS, and nutrition assistance. The activity will focus on maximizing the impact of the Government of Uganda (GOU), the United States Government (USG), and other investments in health services and systems using a district-based integrated package of quality health, HIV/AIDS, nutrition, and child development services to contribute to significant, measurable, and sustainable impact on the beneficiary population. The support to districts under Regional Health Integration to Enhance Services in Eastern Uganda will be complemented by linkages with national hea

Professional A&E Services: Architect-engineer (A&E) design for the Saving Mothers Giving Life (SMGL) Phase II and improving infrastructure in up to five of Uganda?s Protected Areas (PAs)the USAID/Uganda Mission; under Global Architect-Engineer Services II IDIQ

USAID Regional Health Integration to Enhance Services- ? North, Acholi (RHITES-N, Acholi): The purpose of the Regional Health Integration to Enhance Services ? North, Acholi (RHITES-N, Acholi) contract is to increase the effective use of sustainable health services in the Acholi Region of Northern Uganda. Working through a life-cycle lens, over five years this contract is expected to contribute to measurable improvements in key population-based national health indicators. RHITES-N, Acholi is one of the upcoming USAID/Uganda activities for comprehensive regional health and HIV/AIDS programs. By responding to disease-specific burdens in respective regions and concentrating increased resources on specific interventions in focus districts, RHITES-N, Acholi is expected to provide a significant, measurable, and lasting impact on key indicators such as HIV and malaria prevalence; mater

USAID Regional Health Integration to Enhance Services- ? North, Lango (RHITES-N, Lango): The purpose of the Regional Health Integration to Enhance Services  North, Lango (RHITES-N, Lango) contract is to increase the access and utilization of quality health services in the Lango Region of Northern Uganda, developing health systems to sustain these goals. Working through a life-cycle lens, over five years this contract is expected to contribute to measurable improvements in key population-based national health indicators. RHITES-N, Lango is one of the upcoming USAID/Uganda activities for comprehensive regional health and HIV/AIDS programs. By responding to disease-specific burdens in respective regions and concentrating increased resources on specific interventions in focus districts, RHITES-N, Lango is expected to provide a significant, measurable, and lasting impact on key ind

Power Africa/Uganda: Power Africa/Uganda is to support the Government of Uganda's (GOU) efforts to accelerate investments in clean energy (CE) as a means to increase electricity generation capacity and expand electricity access among rural and urban communities.

ODG: Anti-Corruption Support to AC Champions (SACCI) Activity: The purpose of the Support to Anti-Corruption Champion Institutions (SACCI) is to enhance institutional accountability and capability to deter corruption and to develop and support a citizen constituency for fighting corruption in Ukraine. USAID assistance will support strengthening Institutional accountability and mechanisms to fight corruption, as well as enhance communication on Anti Corruption reforms, and empower a core constituency of Anti-Corruption reformers to monitor corrupt practices in and actively collaborate with government institutions in fighting corruption.
OEG: Support for Reform and Privatization of State Owned Energy Companies: Support for Reform and Privatization of State Owned Energy Companies. This is a Task Order under PFM IDIQ.
OEG: Competitive Energy Markets (U-CEM) Project: The purpose of this activity is to promote enabling environment, privatization and investment in private sector.

OEG: Trade and Competitiveness Initiative: The Trade and Competitiveness Initiative will be aimed at increased competition in domestic markets, improved competitiveness of Ukrainian firms in markets abroad, and expanded opportunities for them to export goods and services.
USPSC position supporting Agent Orange remediation in Vietnam (to replace Andrew Sayers-Fay): USPSC position supporting Agent Orange remediation in Vietnam (to replace Andrew Sayers-Fay)
USPSC position supporting Agent Orange remediation in Vietnam (to replace Maura Patterson): USPSC position supporting Agent Orange remediation in Vietnam (to replace Maura Patterson)

Jaba Nuba Water Project: Jaba Nuba Water Project - The objective of this Task Order is to improve the regional water system and expand services to new customers in order to bring clean water to the northwest villages of the Hebron Governorate.

Youth Cohort Study for PARTNERSHIPS WITH YOUTH Program: Youth Cohort Study for USAID West Bank and Gaza?s PARTNERSHIPS WITH YOUTH Program - The Youth Cohort Study is intended to deepen USAID's understanding of youth participant outcomes. The Longitudinal Youth Cohort Study will focus on participants aged 18-25, enrolling between January and April 2017, in the following five USAID-supported Youth Development Resource Centers (YDRCs): Group (1) Qalqilya, Jenin, Jericho; Group (2), Hebron, Jerusalem and Nablus. The Youth Cohort Study is designed to be a panel study, collecting data on the same group of youth over an 18 month period following enrollment in the USAID-supported YDRC. This approach provides more reliable and nuanced information about youth outcomes and allows for the benefits of the program to accrue before final data collection. The

Al Jalameh Road: Objective No. 1 of this Task Order is to upgrade Al Jalameh crossing which is one of the most important crossing points between the West Bank and Israel and the only available crossing in the Jenin governorate. The crossing is currently used by yellow-plated vehicles, pedestrians, and back-to-back transfer of merchandise. The crossing is located along Highway 60 north of Jenin, close to Al Jalameh Village in area ?C.? Objective No. 2 of this Task Order is to rehabilitate a section of the existing road that connects Tulkarem to Al Sha?raweya cluster starting from Shuweika village up to the entrance of Deir Al Ghsoun. The road is a section of Jenin - Tulkarem road (Route 584). The total length of Deir Al Ghsoun - Al Jarosheyah Road to be rehabilitated is approximately 5.5 km and stretches ov

Middle Area Desalination Plant Expansion Project: The objective of this Task Order is to expand the water treatment capacity of the existing Middle Area Desalination Plant from 2,600 cubic meters per day of treated potable water to 6,000 cubic meters per day of treated potable water. The existing plant and the new plant are located in the Middle Area Governorate of Gaza, with the new plant constructed within the current boundaries of the existing plant.
Gaza Reservoirs and Networks: Gaza reservoirs and network construction

Building Foundations: IDIQ for construction services in West Bank and Gaza - Building Foundation is expected to be a multi-year, multiple award holder IDIQ focused on providing the necessary capacity to support the WBG Mission's construction efforts in the water, transportation, health, education and energy sectors.

Accountable Governance for Improved Service Delivery (AGIS): To improve service delivery and accountability by strengthening procurement, audit, and internal control functions in targeted ministries. These ministries include Health, Community Development, Mother and Child Health, and Education. Proposed activities are supported by analyses within the sector and findings from the Public Financial Management, Risk Assessment Framework (PFMRAF) conducted recently by USAID Zambia

Integrating Agriculture, Nutrition and Water and Sanitation Project: The Economic Development, Health and Education Offices propose a jointly-managed integrated agriculture, nutrition, and water and sanitation activity to reduce stunting through agricultural, water and sanitation and behavior change pathways in targeted districts of Zambia. The expected geographic focus will be in Eastern Province, potentially with selected districts in Central or Muchinga Provinces. Addressing stunting requires children and pregnant and lactating women are consuming adequate quantity, quality and diversity of food and that adequate health conditions exist for them to biologically utilize what they eat. This requires a complexity of interventions that increase access and availability of safe, diverse, nutritious food (usually relying on home production), adoption of better

Evaluate for Improved Impact: Will provide assistance to the Health Office, implementing partners, local partners and most importantly Government of Zambia stakeholders as each strives to improve data systems and utilization.

Sustainable and Effective Education Delivery (SEED): Assist the Ministry of Education to provide textbooks and learning materials in the seven local languages and English for primary school children; teachers' professional development particularly in the area of reading pedagogy and instruction; and conducting testing and reading assessments at the school level.

Research, Evaluation, Assessment and Data (READ): Assist the Ministry of General Education, particularly the Examinations Council of Zambia, to institutionalize learners performance assessment at the school, zone, district and provincial levels and to conduct research such as baselines, midlines, end-line assessments.

Increasing Citizen Demand for Accountable and Transparent Service Delivery in the Health Sector through Enhanced Community-Based Monitoring: The project will seek to mobilize communities and increase their engagement in monitoring the delivery of health services. Proposed activities will include enhancing citizens? action based on basic facts on utilization and quality of services collected from the communities themselves. It will include improving upon or developing community-based monitoring tools such as report cards, social contracts, and action plans. This component will seek to strengthen existing local governance social structures such, as the neighborhood health committees, health advisory committees, and/or safe-motherhood action groups. Health service providers under the government will also be involved to improve and strengthen their engagement with community members.

Governance and Growth Program: Governance and Growth Project will address transparency and accountability in decision making and policy constraints to public and private sector development. The project will use RFP Mechanism.
All Children Reading - Asia Task Order (ACR-Asia TO): All Children Reading - Asia Task Order (ABE-ACR IDIQ)

FFP Food Assistance Project in Liberia: This is a multi-year food assistance development project funded with DA (CDF) from BFS for FFP projects in Liberia. Maximum will be $66 million over five years in CDF. Most likely one awardee to be completed by the fall of 2016.
fields.place_of_performance_state: Bureau for Democracy, Conflict and Humanitarian Assistance (DCHA)

fields.description: EISM Empowerment and Inclusion Support Mechanism: The purpose of this activity is to support USAID?s goal of promoting inclusive development through the establishment of an umbrella Empowerment and Inclusion Solicitation and Management (EISM) mechanism. In particular, the activity will focus on reducing risks to and reinforcing the capacities of communities, NGOs, and governments to provide services, to protect and promote the rights of vulnerable and marginalized populations, and to expand access to opportunities that support their full participation in society. The award will support a range of management, technical, and administrative tasks to achieve and sustain progress in reaching vulnerable and marginalized populations in developing countries. This will include support for: improved access to quality services; training; local capac
fields.place_of_performance_state: Bureau for Democracy, Conflict and Humanitarian Assistance (DCHA)

fields.description: Analytical Services IV: The Analytical Services IV IDIQ will directly build on USAID?s DRG Strategy by providing support to USAID Missions and other operating units to develop strategies and projects that will have the greatest impact. Ultimately, USAID strategies and programs that are based on sound analysis are more likely to be effective. Missions will be able to quickly and efficiently commission analyses, access expert assistance, and obtain other services in support of strategic planning, policy analysis and development, and project design. The IDIQ will allow the DRG Center to continue to conduct and support DRG sector and sub-sector assessments, political economy analyses, inclusive development analysis ? on gender, disabilities, LGBT, youth, indigenous, etc. -- and other strategic planning priorities
fields.place_of_performance_state: Bureau for Democracy, Conflict and Humanitarian Assistance (DCHA)

fields.description: FEWS NET 7: New phase of the Famine Early Warning Systems Network, FEWS NET.
fields.place_of_performance_state: Bureau for Democracy, Conflict and Humanitarian Assistance (DCHA)

fields.description: Active Communities - Effective States (ACES): The purpose of this award is to provide technical assistance and advisory services, training, and direct program implementation to support good governance, transparency, and accountability in host countries. This award is designed to foster greater accountability of institutions and leaders to citizens and to the law by strengthening linkages among government actors and enhancing state institutions accountability to citizens. The activities implemented under this award will contribute directly to the achievement of the overarching goal of USAID's Strategy on Democracy, Human Rights and Governance, which is to support the establishment and consolidation of inclusive and accountable democracies to advance freedom and development. This award will enable Missions which issue task orders under
fields.place_of_performance_state: Bureau for Democracy, Conflict and Humanitarian Assistance (DCHA)

fields.description: Developing Regional Energy Markets: Developing Regional Energy Markets (Clean Energy Non-CPC IDIQ)
Financial Compliance Services: Cuba - Financial Compliance Services
fields.place_of_performance_state: Bureau for Latin America and the Caribbean (LAC)

fields.description: Monitoring and Evaluation Services: Cuba - Monitoring and Evaluation Services
fields.place_of_performance_state: Bureau for Latin America and the Caribbean (LAC)

fields.description: LAC Youth Violence Prevention Task Order: This is for the Latin America and the Caribbean Youth Violence Prevention Task Order to be procured under the YouthPower: Evidence and Evaluation IDIQ.
fields.place_of_performance_state: Bureau for Latin America and the Caribbean (LAC)

fields.description: Annual Program Statement for Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning: FY17 Annual Program Statement for Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning
fields.place_of_performance_state: Bureau for Policy, Planning and Learning (PPL)

fields.description: LEAP III (Learning, Evaluation and Analysis Project): New LEAP III - Will increase access to rigorous, independent technical evaluation and analysis within and beyond USAID - finalizing PAD
PFM II IDIQ: Follow on award to Public Financial Management IDIQ (PFM)
Utility Partnership Program: Program to support global utility partnerships and enhance utility performance

Engineering and Construction Knowledge Management Task Order: New knowledge management task order under the A&E II IDIQ to help develop engineering training, references, and tools and support the implementation of USAID construction portfolio risk management.
Engineering Support Task Order: Task order under the A&E II IDIQ to provide engineering capacity to USAIDW & Missions.
Scaling Up Renewable Energy: Scaling up renewable energy through planning, incentives, competitive procurement, and renewable energy zones.
Communications and Knowledge Management Task Order: Task Order under ADVANTAGE IDIQ to provide strategic communications and knowledge management to Gender Office
fields.place_of_performance_state: Office of Gender Equality & Women?s Empowerment (E3/GEWE)

fields.description: Climate Integration Facility: This five-year mechanism will support Operating Units (OUs) in integrating climate change adaptation and mitigation, including implementation of Executive Order 13677. The emphasis will be on providing climate information and analysis, often with relatively quick turnaround. Contractor may provide services such as: fact sheets, facilitators, and analysis (both desk review and targeted analysis). Could also provide support for internal communications, development of materials, trainings and thought leadership.

Addendum to the Global Health Broad Agency Announcement: Addendums to the Global Health BAA related to the Health Research Program 2.0 (HaRP 2.0) are anticipated to support co-creation efforts in evidence generation and application to strengthen systems that promote health and reduce mortality and severe morbidity of newborns, children, and mothers; reduce the burden of malaria and other infectious diseases; as well as respond to other health and development priorities as needed. These addendums will involve implementation research, research utilization, and other approaches to help accelerate adoption, sustained utilization, and support planning for scale of new and improved tools, technologies, policies, strategies, and approaches.
